name: NYC Local Law 144 - Automated Employment Decision Tools
description: New York City Local Law 144 compliance framework for automated employment decision tools (AEDTs) requiring bias audits and candidate notifications.

structure.title: AEDT Classification & Scope
structure.description: Requirements for determining AEDT applicability under NYC Local Law 144

items.title: AEDT Applicability Determination
items.summary: The organization must determine whether any tool used in hiring or promotion qualifies as an Automated Employment Decision Tool (AEDT) under NYC Local Law 144.
questions: Is the tool a computational process derived from machine learning, statistical modeling, data analytics, or AI?
Does the tool issue a simplified output (score, classification, or recommendation)?
Is the output used to substantially assist or replace discretionary decision making in hiring or promotion?

structure.title: Bias Audit Requirements
structure.description: Independent bias audit requirements for AEDTs

items.title: Independent Annual Bias Audit
items.summary: Each AEDT must undergo an independent bias audit before use and at least once annually.
questions: Is the audit conducted by an independent third party?
Is the auditor uninvolved in developing or distributing the tool?
Does the audit evaluate disparate impact across legally protected categories?
Does the audit calculate selection rates and impact ratios?
Does the audit use historical or test data consistent with DCWP rules?

items.title: Bias Audit Publication
items.summary: A summary of the most recent bias audit must be publicly available prior to AEDT use.
questions: Is the summary posted on the employer or vendor website?
Does the summary include the audit date?
Does the summary include the distribution date of the AEDT?
Does the summary include selection rates and impact ratios?
Will the summary remain publicly accessible for at least 6 months?

structure.title: Candidate Notice & Transparency
structure.description: Requirements for notifying candidates about AEDT use

items.title: Advance Candidate Notice
items.summary: Candidates and employees must receive notice at least 10 business days before AEDT use.
questions: Does the notice inform that an AEDT will be used?
Does the notice describe job qualifications assessed?
Does the notice describe characteristics evaluated?
Does the notice provide instructions for requesting an alternative process or accommodation?

items.title: Data Use Disclosure
items.summary: The organization must disclose the type of data collected and the source of that data.
questions: Does the disclosure describe input data categories?
Does the disclosure identify data sources?
Is the disclosure accessible to candidates upon request?
Is the disclosure available publicly if not provided individually?

items.title: Data Retention Disclosure
items.summary: The organization must disclose its AEDT data retention policy.
questions: Is the retention duration stated?
Are deletion practices described?
Is the retention policy available to candidates?

structure.title: Alternative Selection & Accommodations
structure.description: Requirements for providing alternative evaluation processes

items.title: Alternative Selection Process
items.summary: Candidates must be allowed to request an alternative evaluation process or reasonable accommodation.
questions: Are clear instructions provided for requesting alternatives?
Are requests processed in a timely manner?
Is there protection against retaliation or disadvantage for requesting alternatives?

structure.title: Documentation & Record Keeping
structure.description: Record retention requirements for compliance demonstration

items.title: Record Retention
items.summary: The organization must retain documentation demonstrating compliance.
questions: Are bias audits retained?
Are notice records retained?
Is disclosure evidence retained?
Does retention support regulatory inspection?

items.title: Vendor Responsibility Allocation
items.summary: Responsibility for compliance must be defined when AEDTs are vendor supplied.
questions: Do contracts allocate audit responsibility?
Is audit publication responsibility assigned?
Does the employer retain responsibility for candidate notice?

items.title: Pre-Use Compliance Verification
items.summary: No AEDT may be used unless all Local Law 144 obligations are satisfied.
questions: Is the bias audit completed?
Is the audit summary published?
Is the candidate notice process operational?
